file_content.text: My engineers are building the sonic repulsion system from the parts you supplied me. Won't be long now.
Superb work, simply superb! Not only did you dismantle the Republic relay stations, you destroyed their signal center!
Soldiers who perform to the letter of their mission details are a rare and valuable commodity.
Make sure you show your appreciation.
Exactly how valuable?
You'll find your payment to be very generous, believe me.
I'm not your soldier, Imperial.
Learn your place.
Too bad. With you taking orders from me, I could win this war in no time.
Imperial commanders who aren't blowhards are an even rarer thing.
You're insufferable.
I know what you mean--I have to share the commissary with them.
In my line of work, incompetents tend to turn up dead.
Doesn't say much for your men.
Don't sell yourself short. I've met some failures from your department in my time.
I'm happy to have served, Commander.
My pleasure.
Happy, sad, bored... I don't care. As long as it's done and done right.
I hear praise like that a lot.
I won't argue. With you in my detail, I could win this war in no time.
I see you've returned with the parts from the Republic relay stations, fine.
But Captain Neuwt informs me the sonic pulse is still being emitted from the Balmorran Arms Factory. Why didn't you complete your mission?
Sith have our own ideas on what is and is not important to complete.
None of your business.
I don't answer to you, Imperial.
You're not my master.
My reasons are confidential, Commander.
None of your concern.
I often take little liberties in my missions. That's the fun of being me.
That's my prerogative.
All that matters is that the Republic can't benefit from the pulse.
The enemy has been thwarted.
That's true, but I wanted to rub their face in it a little.
I tried.
Too bad. That would have been an extra little slap in the face for the Republic.
My corps of engineers will work on the parts you brought me, and I'll have a working sonic repulsion system before you can blink.
Keeping the Colicoids away from our military assets--and keeping the Republic from doing the same--might just swing this battle.
What are you doing here? No one summoned you. I've got a war to wage.
